title: Obama gives G7 press conference after meeting with Iraqi PM â as it happened | World news | The Guardian
summary: is putin wrong-headedly 'trying to recreate soviet empire 's greatness ?
obama 's press conference is now starting .

text: thanks for tuning in , this live blog is now over .

documents.title: summary
text: the us president spoke on a range of domestic and foreign policy concerns , namely us healthcare and immigration reform and the coalition efforts to combat isis in iraq and syria .

some of the key points made : ¢ obama saved his strongest words for russia , echoing angela merkel 's earlier statement that sanctions will stay in place as long as russia continues to violate terms of the minks agreement .

¢ he said the us supreme court should never even have taken up the health care law challenge ¢ obama declined to implicate china in the latest hacks on the us opm database , instead saying that congress needs to pass cybersecurity bill .
he also said that these types of hacks would become more frequent .
¢ he said that regarding the strategy against isis militants , more efforts were needed to make stem the flow of foreign fighters , and says turkish-syria border needs closer monitoring .
responding to a question about a possible increase of us troops , obama said that all countries in the international coalition were prepared to do more to train iraqi security forces .

documents.title: press conference over
text: and with his final remarks on the affordable care act , obama exits the stage .
q on us healthcare : what can you say to reassure people and insurers about healthcare markets going into chaos ( relating to impending supreme court ruling ) ?
obama says that under well-established precedents , there is no reason why existing exchanges should be overturned through a court case .
those who pass legislation , never intended for folks going through federal exchange to not get subsidies .
this should be an easy case .
he says the supreme court should n't even have taken up the case .
part of what 's bizarre about this whole thing , is it 's working .
over 16m people have gotten health insurance and the overwhelming majority are satisfied with it , he says .
q : on immigration in us policy : we are being as aggressive as we can legally , to appeal the district court ruling on executive actions which were challenged , obama says .
one of the key provisions for me was for undocumented people to get legal status after background checks .
that requires an administrative apparatus .
i made a decision , which i think is the right one that we should not accept applications until the legal status of this is clarified .
i do n't want to bring people in have them jump through a lot of hoops and have the process delayed further .
the one great way to solve the problem is to have congress act , obama said , noting that the majority of americans want it to happen and immigration will be important in next presidential campaign

documents.title: is putin wrong-headedly 'trying to recreate soviet empire 's greatness ?
text: q : on sanctions for russia .
sanctions will remain in place while russia continues to violate minks agreement .
there was discussion about additional steps needed to be taken if russia working through separatists doubled down on aggression inside ukraine , obama said .

he says ultimately , that this is an issue for putin : he needs to decide ; does he continue to wreck his country 's economy and continue russia 's isolation in pursuit of a wrong-headed desire to recreate soviet empire 's greatness ?
or does he recognize that russia 's greatness does n't depend on violating other countries ' sovereignty ?
russian speakers inside ukraine are bearing the brunt of the fighting .
their economies collapsed , lives collapsed they 're suffering , obama said .
q : on islamic state .
bluntly , what is and is n't working on strategy ?
obama says the us has made significant progress in pushing back isis from areas in which they occupied or disrupted local populations .
says isis is nimble and opportunistic .
we need to improve speed at which we 're training iraqi forces .
train and assist posture is the most effective , he says .
otherwise , morale and lack of equipment undermines the efforts .
we want to train and better equip iraqi forces .
abadi wants this as well .
when a finalized plan is presented to me by pentagon , i will present it to the american people .
we do n't yet have a finalized plan because the iraqis have n't given it to us yet .
fair to say that all the countries in the international coalition are prepared to do more to train more iraqi security forces if they feel more work has been taken advantage of .
we 're still seeing places where we have more training capacity than we have recruits .
wants to see more recruits - including outreach to sunni tribes .
we 've seen these prepared to fight isil and have been successful in rebuffing isil .
wants to see more from abadi and iraqi legislature to move forward on national guard law to help devolve some of the sec efforts to local folks ( e.g .
anbar ) and to get more rapid involvement from sunni tribes .
he mentions sahwa/sunni awakening of 2007 .
need to make more progress in stemming flow of foreign fighters , he said .
notes some progress made but not enough .
still thousands flowing into first syria and then iraq oftentimes , and not all is preventable - but a lot is .
need to monitor turkish-syria border turks recognize it 's a problem he said , but it 's something that needs improving .
cutting off foreign fighter flow , will help solve problem in long-term .
political agenda of inclusion remains as important as military fight , obama said he told abadi a veiled reference to the shia government 's exclusion of sunni actors .
abadi is very much committed to that policy but obama notes the prime minister inherited the system .
q : how frustrated are you that after your personal concerns on cybersecurity about china 's opm hack ?
and concerns about fifa corruption case ?
on fifa : obama says he can not comment on an active case .
but in conversations he 's had in europe , people think it is very important for fifa to be able to operate with integrity , transparency and accountability .

as the investigation and charges proceed , we have to keep in mind , although football/soccer ( depending on which side of the atlantic you live on ) it 's a game , but also a massive business and a source of incredible national pride .
the us , he notes , is improving with each world cup and a sport gaining in popularity in the us should operate in an upright manner .
on china : we have n't yet publicly unveiled who we think may have engaged in the cyberattacks , and he would n't comment on allegations .
but we have known for a long time that there are vulnerabilities and these will continue .
this is why it 's so important for congress to pass cybersecurity legislation .
notes the need for new systems , infrastructure and better computer hygiene by personnel .
obama says state and non-state actors can be involved in these types of hacks .
in either case we need to be more aggressive and attentive and notes that these hacks are going to be more common .
q : do you believe europeans are being too tough on greece ?
and what else needs to be done ?
obama says greece needs to follow through and make tough political choices which will be good in the long-term .
international agencies need to recognize extraordinary challenges that greece faces .
we will continue to consult with all parties involved .
q : separate and somewhat related to the french said you told leaders that you 're concerned the dollar is too strong ?
obama tells reporter not to believe unnamed quotes , saying he did not say that .
obama takes questions :
finally , obama commends merkel for ensuring the summit had a focus on women , and their educational opportunities in developed and developing worlds .
on iran , we remain united heading into the final phases of the talks .
on discussions with abadi , and the tunisian and nigerian presidents : we discussed the threats of isil and boko haram .
g7 will further coordinate counter-terror operations .
with respect to security , the g7 remains united on ukraine , he says : the us is committed to providing assistance to ukraine to maintain its democracy .
he notes , the g7 has met for the second year in a row without russia , a testament to its continued isolation , regarding its stance and actions in ukraine .
important to note russia 's economy has been severely weakened .
russia 's actions in ukraine are hurting russia and hurting the russian people .
sanctions will remain in place as long as russia violates minks agreement , obama says .
the president notes the strong job growth in the us private sector and the declining us unemployment rates .
in the global economy , america is a major source of strength .

obama begins by noting how the g7 leaders are here to stand up for the fundamental principles they share as democracies : peace and the rights of peoples to decide their own destinies , and for human rights .

documents.title: obama 's press conference is now starting .
text: obama 's press conference is now starting .
my colleague kate connelly has been tweeting from the g7 summit , and unearthed this gem .

kate connolly ( @ connollyberlin ) while the world is shut out of # g7 talks it 's left to this # afp to tell real story # everypicturetellsastory on sunday , obama had received a warm welcome from merkel , and a host of men in lederhosen .
the two leaders sat down to a breakfast of the local sausage weisswurst and a glass of weissbier and pretzels before the two days of intensive g7 summit talks began .
despite the folkore-filled greeting , the german chancellor had been frostier than usual in her welcome speech .

despite using his first name , she immediately made a veiled reference to the tensions between the us and germany over the scandal surrounding germany 's intelligence agents allegedly helping the us 's nsa to spy on officials and companies in europe .

although it 's true we have differences of opinion from time to time , the united states of america is our friend and essential partner with whom we cooperate closely because it 's in our mutual interest , she said .
angela merkel , the german chancellor and g7 summit host , has just spoken .
merkel said that g7 leaders were ready if necessary to strengthen sanctions against russia over its involvement in the ukraine conflict .
the german leader also said the leaders want russia and ukraine to comply with the 12 february ceasefire , agreed in belarus , which largely halted the fighting in eastern ukraine .

we are also ready , should the situation escalate , which we do n't want , to strengthen sanctions if the situation makes that necessary but we believe we should do everything to move forward the political process of minsk , she told the final news conference of a two-day g7 summit in bavaria .
barack obama is set to give a press conference at the g7 summit at schloss elmau in bavaria at 4pm / 10 am et .
it comes on the heels of a bilateral meeting with iraqi prime minister haider al-abadi .
the two leaders met on the sidelines of the summit of leading industrial democracies .
obama said on monday that he was confident islamic state militants could be driven out of iraq and ultimately defeated , but he noted that there would surely be setbacks along the way .
thanking the g7 leaders for their support , abadi urged the g7 leaders to help defeat isis militants , and prevent the group from profiting from its oil smuggling trade .
